title: @Riot: What are your thoughts on Veigar in LCS
body:
Very simple and to the point, is {{champion:45}} seen as too good or is he in a good spot as he seems to be a niche pick depending on what the enemy team has.

Would love to know what everyone thinks.

replies.body: Doesn't seem excessively strong in pro play, is looking like he might be too strong in regular play though. Suspect we'll have to nerf him at some point soonish as a result if that trend continues, though we don't have plans lined up just yet at least.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mjc8Id0u,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-07T23:32:22.486+0000)
>
> Doesn't seem excessively strong in pro play, is looking like he might be too strong in regular play though. Suspect we'll have to nerf him at some point soonish as a result if that trend continues, though we don't have plans lined up just yet at least.

thanks. while we're at it any galio nerfs
http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/masonry/000/259/943/694.png
Nothing planned, far as I know we haven't seen anything to indicate he's out of line at present either.
You should nerf him, he is freelo atm.
with all the 4 ad teams ..... sure
The way Veigar gets AP, full AD teams don't counter him anymore.  He shouldn't be able to point-and-click delete a fed ADC 25 min into a game, but he can.

except he can't actually point and click an adc to death, his q and w are essential to that kill and if it feels point and click the adc probably walked into the stun wall and deserves to die. the ult only has a 100 percent ratio, if he is one shotting your adc either he is super fed to the point where pretty much any damage character is one shotting your adc, or he isn't point and click killing anything.

Besides its his role to delete squishies, at the cost of being easily deleted himself. that's actually what balance looks like, you want veigar to not kill you? kill him first.

if you want to let him get ahead farm and get kills which is the only way he can get fed enough to delete an adc from the game with only his ult and you as and adc dont want to build mr or hp which some adcs do build though later (smart ones if they realizes they keep dieing) and i think that its not good that if anything causes an adc to have to divert their full damage build path riot immediately nerfs it. where is the strategic diversity there?

I feel like infinite scaling and being able to farm to that point are kind of a reward for doing so. In a 1 hour game and nasus presses Q 5 times your whole team probably just died.

edit for clarity
I play game with Nasus like that. I think he got a 1000 on it or some huge number like that. No matter what it was it was able to two shot the towers. Worst thing was it was only 40min game.
I love Susan but I hate dealing with the inevitable FACT that your team will eventually start being like, "bro why you afk farming, laning phase is over".

I won a game against Nasus because he didn't stop AFK farming
I was even 0/4/0 by level 6 (I hate Xin Zhao with all of my hate) 
Then I roamed and He didn't 
The gold deficit on my team was quickly neutralized and then reversed 

Of course it helped a lot that Nasus rushed a trinity force and a sterak's
Lol! Well I will say that I did yell that sort of thing at him but it was more"Dood! They are all group up in mid and pushing down are towers! Come help us!

The difference between Nasus and Veigar is Nasus can be kited quite easily.  Veigar can sit back from a safer range and do tons of damage with 3 of his abilities, none of which require him to get into melee range.

No my whole team didn't just die.  But I've been both on the same team as and playing against Veigars who could just point-and-click delete a fed ADC or squishy jungler.  It's to the point where it's beyond ridiculous - even the players who are playing Veigar say the same thing.  Veigar gets AP from assists instead of just kills, so he ramps up much faster than a Nasus.  He can one-click delete an ADC 25 min into the game.  It's a little out of hand.

Look I just typed out this super long response using math to prove that this is negligible but since my cat decided to start my day with a fuck you I'm going to TLDR for ya.

If you have the worst team ever and gave him 20 assists by the 20 minute point that's 100 extra dmg on his ULT assuming he got every one of the assists after level 8. Aside from the fact that your team is already boned from the gold disparity, you're probably already dead if 100hp would've saved your life from the ULT...he can still press Q or probably even AA you for that matter.

Granted, but that's a worst-case-scenario type thing.  I'm talking regular play over a regular game with regular CS, Veigar can still get out of hand very quickly.  His AP scaling doesn't just come from kills/assists, but also minion and large-monster kills.  And his kit is too punishing to solo queue teams where communication is rare.  It's easy for a Veigar to just sit back and farm and end up hard carrying a game after 25-30 minutes.  

Of course there are ways to shut him down, but you're simply too punished if you don't.  It's like a Nasus - if the game is stalled out long enough, he'll eventually get to the point where he can one-shot you.  And there are plenty of team comps that can stall the game.  You have to remember that Veigar is never the only player on the team - there are 4 others.  No game takes place in a bubble.

Meh, most champs can carry a game if fed. Veigar just gets fed without the kills I spose. 

I will say chat is in the game for a reason. I wish they'd remove it but asking for a gank and considering that champ select matters are both important things and integral parts of the game.

I personally know that as soon as I here that flash sound mid I tell my jungler to camp the shit out of mid for the next 5 minutes because he's free until it's back up.

That's entirely my point.  I don't mind a champ carrying the game if they get fed off kills.  That's to be expected.  But when a champion snowballs harder than the rest of the players in the game due to gaining AP from CS and then having such high AP ratios that amplify his power, it gets a little out of hand.

Hey Meddler, 

I love Veigar, but there may or may not be a bug with his E granting assists BEFORE the stun is active. Here's a link to a post I made ~2 weeks ago. Sadly it never got noticed, but I think if Veigar does need future changes, this should be looked at, because it can lead to a lot of gold/AP which might not be obtained otherwise

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/aBLwwEQj-veigars-e-grants-assists-before-stun-is-active-rleagueoflegends

as a TL;DR, the potential bug is that if you are in the event horizon zone as it arms, but before leave BEFORE the stun is active and never get stunned or trapped in the cage, Veigar still gets an assist even if he never was able to get any damage down. I argue that, while he should be getting assists for anyone stuck inside his E AFTER the stun is armed (as they are forced to stay in a confined space or usually burn a summoner to get out)  it shouldn't work this way for BEFORE the stun is armed, because champions like Bard, Ziggs, Pantheon, Cho'Gath, etc... who have indicators for spells that take time to arm do not get assists without actually doing damage to the enemy if someone was in the indicator and died before it was active (or left it before it armed and died to someone else)

nerf Veigar. Cut veigar's power.   cut veigar. cut = shorter.
Is that a short joke

well do you mean he's weak atm or were you joking?

... can i share a bit of feedback, mainly about the Q passive?

See, the change that you get full gain from assists to me was a great gain: everytime you do an effort like ganking a lane or trying to get a kill while with other people feels really unsatisfying to not get AP because an ally has slain the enemy and you did not KS. It should be said that the kill itself can be considered a gain good enough, but to me was like part of my power identity was not working.

On the other hand, i have seen a thing... Veigar can snowball too much easily thanks to that, because is way easier to get AP.

This said: what are your toughts about making Q passive scale not with Q rank, but instead simply with level? As now he is able to max Q first and get 5 AP with each kill at level 8, that with recent level changes is quite early and leaves him with too many opportunities to snowball with it. If instead he scaled with level you could manipulate it al will, and delay the Ap gain to later phases of the game, while at the same time don't  make Q first mandatory ( even tought this is probably a buff too much great to support Veigar).

Sorry if i sound arrogant on my standings, or manipulative even, but i am just worried that a champion i loved since i started playing and came back to the spotlight only recently after a rather rough period of time gets back again to the "just for fun" pit.

What if, they amount gained from assists was lessened? like maybe half or he could even gain something else from it, maybe passive magic pen (that would be super OP though, so it's more to open the thinking field, cause then you would WANT more assists as well)

I tought about that but i discarded it, because in that way we go half way back before the change where it feels unsatisying to get assist as i said before.

Also levels can be handled in many different ways, becoming a new balance lever.

Let's assume he gets Q to max rank and has somehow accumulated 5 kills. Thats 25 AP. That's basically an Amp. Tome. I don't feel like that's game breaking. having 100 CS in the same time frame is 4 times better minimum.

But he gets the same amount of AP from assists.  So what if he has 5 kills and 12 assists?  That then becomes 85 AP very quickly.  And then you have to factor in his AP gain from minion and monster kills.  It gets out of hand very quickly, as more AP leads to more minion kills, kills/assists, which leads to more AP, which leads to more minion kills, kills/assists, etc, etc, etc.  Don't you see something wrong with this pattern?

By the point in the game at which it matters...no I don't. 

If this is at the pre-20 minute mark you've probably already lost due to the gold disparity unless you're just playing in a game where ppl said fuck the farm I want a rambo style, jungle brawl. 

At the 40 minute mark when he's got 300+ farm and 1400 AP you're supposed to die when something hits you for 2k+ dmg.

To devil's advocate my own point. Lets say his Q passive didn't exist. He could still press R and hit you in the face for 1200 dmg assuming an absurdly moderate 700 AP.

Well, if you're down 20 kills 20 minutes in, then yes, your point is correct.  What I'm saying is if the kills are even and Veigar has a decent kill participation, he gets a large amount of AP growth.  And normal AP champions don't get 700 AP so quickly that the enemy team doesn't have a chance to respond the same way that is possible for Veigar.  

Veigar's winrate is 53.1% in Diamond.  You'd think players at that level could counter him until you realize that as player skill goes up, so does Veigar players' skill.  This simply displays the fact that Veigar has too much scaling and too high of ratios to be healthy.  Even Meddler himself said that Veigar seems to be too strong in regular play.  I'm not the only one saying this.

In fact is more the solo Q aspect the one i am.more concerned with, because he can get.out of hand too much quickly too much early in a very random environment.

Pros already started deploying Tahm to counter him and his combos ( isn't he supposed to be his ally?) , and probably they will bring out many other strats.

However, above everything, i would like to not have him touched atm, my feedback was more an exploration in case he is considered to much strong.

Ah Shlack noted, i don't think it is a comparison that can stand: if you consider assists the number can get out.of hand quickly. 

Plus, you have to consider that farming minions takes time ( where you can't play more incisively for the team and where you are more visible to the enemy, severly reducing your threath across the map ), mana, and has the added risk to be more subsceptible to proactive action from the enemy ( harrass, ganks, outtrades and kills ).

Sure, aiming for the kill is not always the best thing, but neither is permafarming.
Let's simply make his Q stacking go back to only gaining from minion/monster kills.  That way he's more like Nasus and less like a champion with a built-in Mejais from the get-go.

Honestly, i'd like more the opposite where he only gets ap by kills/assists imho.

I prefer live one, just saying in case i had to choose

Veigar is the mid I play the most. While I agree that he could use a love tap, I think the problem is that his AP stacking is a little too fast. Revert the buff to let him get AP off of assists first and then see where he sits. Then make adjustments from there. I just don't want him to end up unviable.

Yup, his main problem is how quickly he gains AP.  He gains it too quickly and too safely.  His AP gain is what makes the rest of his kit overbearing.  Reduce his scaling or make it riskier, then he'll come back down from orbit.
Veigar doesn't need nerfs. Thanks.

Give all champions who get stacks permanently increasing their power a limit to just how many stacks they can actually have. If the game goes on long enough, it will get to a point where someone like Veigar, or Nasus, or Sion is just unkillable because they just have so many stacks. Infinite power is a bad idea.
Any comments on why y'all feel he's too strong in regular play?  Any information on where you feel he has too much power?

> [{quoted}](name=Adrian Umbra,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mjc8Id0u,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2015-10-07T23:46:36.843+0000)
>
> Any comments on why y'all feel he's too strong in regular play?  Any information on where you feel he has too much power?

It's the same reason while several people who seemed balanced on paper are strong in regular play, people do not know how to counter him.

The last time anyone faced a veigar in solo Q or normals they had a slow stun that was easy to dodge. Now thanks to successive and necessary little buffs veigar's stun is back to full speed. People aren't used to it. They don't respect his zoning control or ability to burst anyone.

Is he strong? Maybe? In the right situation he's a god but thats the same with any champion. Any mage who can outrange his E placement will own him and I've killed many a veigar as Rengar Jungle even after he stunned and ulted me. Just build MR, save heals/shield/zhonyas for when he ults and there u go.

Please don't nerf him too hard. There is a LOT of counterplay to him, both in items and in mechanical play, and also in general game strategy. He just isn't seen much, so people don't know how to play against him. They don't seem to realise that a simple Zhonya's before their Rabadon's, or getting  a QSS before their Bloodthirster, or dodging the long delay stun, makes it VERY hard for him to land anything.
You can't itemize against a Veigar who has over 1000 AP 25 min into the game.  I mean you can, but then the rest of his team can beat you since you're itemizing for one champion.
If you let him have 1000 AP at 25 minutes then you messed up hard and deserve to be oneshot. His laning is terrible and should be abused.
